name: getWFSInventory
description: You can use this API to get the current Available to Sell inventory quantities for all WFS items in your catalog. You can also query specific SKUs or filter to only items updated after a specific date in order to reduce the response size.

sku.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the seller, which identifies each item. This will be used by the seller in the XSD file to refer to each item. Special characters in the sku needing encoding are: ':', '/', '?', '#', '[', ']', '@', '!', '$', '&', "'", '(', ')', '*', '+', ',', ';', '=', ‘ ’ as well as '%' itself if it's a part of sku. Make sure to encode space with %20. Other characters don't need to be encoded.

fromModifiedDate.description: last inventory modified date - starting range.

toModifiedDate.description: last inventory modified date - starting range.

limit.description: Number of Sku to be returned. Cannot be larger than 300.

offset.description: Offset is the number of records you wish to skip before selecting records.

WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN.description: The access token retrieved in the Token API call

WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID

$ul: **limit**: Information about the quantity in inventory
**offset**: Offset is the number of records you wish to skip before selecting results.
**totalCount**: Total number of results for query.
